html: Without divine revelation—without direct knowledge communicated from Israel’s God—his people remain vulnerable to the tide of world events that determines their fate. Instead, they could have determined their own fate (Isaiah 8:13-15; 28:7-13 ). The word “knowledge” (da‘at )—a covenant term—further signifies that his people no longer know their God. They may know about him; but they don’t know him in the way that he manifests himself personally to his elect (Isaiah 19:21; 52:6 ). If they did, they would not now perish nor be taken captive by their enemies (Isaiah 10:3-4; 14:16-17 ).
